text:
Hello, would that be possible to dynamically generate items from HubDB table after clicking on a button? I mean not hiding/showing with adding a class with js but dynamically display them?
I mean particularly with pagination while showing list of elements on a listing page, thanks for help!!!
The best way to would be to implement pagination, so like a parameter in the url

I have a question about optimizing background images in a module. Does HubSpot HubL have any functionality to specify small/med/large/full image, sort of like how WordPress manages images? I'm trying to speed up pages. A function that returns an optimized version of the image? Thanks!

Check out the `resize_image_url()`  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#resize-image-url|function in the HubL documentation>!

You can totally pipe your module’s image source into that function, and use it to output a variety of image sizes to go into a `srcset` attribute _(or picture element, or set an element’s `background-image` based on screen size — the world’s your oyster)._
Just tried it out -- that does exactly what I want it to for background images.
